javadoc:
AlignedStructurePacker provides support for performing aligned packing of Structure components.

NOTE: We currently have no way of conveying or supporting explicit bitfield component pragmas supported by some compilers (e.g., bit_field_size, bit_field_align, bit_packing).

methods.name: <init>

params.name: structure
params.comment:
structure whose components need to be packed and updated
 during packing (ordinal, offset, length and bit-field datatypes may be modified)

methods.javadoc:
Perform packing on the structure components.
@return pack result data
methods.name: pack
methods.comment: Perform packing on the structure components.

methods.name: packComponents
methods.comment:
Perform structure component packing.  Specified components may be updated to reflect 
 packing (ordinal, offset, length and bit-field datatypes may be modified).  The caller 
 is responsible for updating structure length and component count based upon
 returned result.  Component count is should only change if component
 list includes DEFAULT members which will be ignored.

params.name: structure
params.comment: structure whose members are to be aligned/packed.

params.name: components
params.comment: structure components (excludes any trailing flexible array).

name: AlignedStructurePacker
comment:
AlignedStructurePacker provides support for performing aligned packing
 of Structure components.
 
 NOTE: We currently have no way of conveying or supporting explicit bitfield component pragmas 
 supported by some compilers (e.g., bit_field_size, bit_field_align, bit_packing).
